intro: Castilleja spiranthoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red to orange flower clusters that resemble paintbrushes. The plant lacks true leaves and relies on its host plants for nutrients through its root system. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its nectar-rich flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
